translated: Connected Discourses 26.1 🔽1. Origin
Linked Discourses The Great Chapter The Eye, Etc.
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo kho, bhikkhave, cakkhussa uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.🔽Yo sotassa uppādo ṭhiti …pe…🔽yo ghānassa uppādo ṭhiti …
analyzed: yaḥ kho bhikkhave cakkhussa uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa isaḥ uppādaḥ rogānam ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ  yo sotassa uppādo pe  yaḥ ghānassa uppādo
translated: “The origination, continuation, arising, and appearance of the eye is the origination of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the appearance of old age and death.🔽The origination, continuation, arising, and appearance of the ear …🔽The origination, continuation, arising, and appearance of the nose …
The origination, continuation, arising, and appearance of the tongue …
The origination, continuation, arising, and appearance of the body …

original: yo manassa uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
analyzed: yaḥ manassa uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa isaḥ uppādaḥ rogānaṃ ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: The origination, continuation, arising, and appearance of the mind is the origination of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the appearance of old age and death.

original: Yo ca, bhikkhave, cakkhussa nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo.🔽Yo sotassa nirodho …pe…🔽yo ghānassa nirodho …
analyzed: yaḥ ca bhikkhave cakkhussa nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ  yaḥ sotassa nirodhaḥ pe  yaḥ ghānassa nirodhaḥ
translated: The cessation, settling, and disappearance of the eye is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the disappearance of old age and death.🔽The cessation, settling, and disappearance of the ear …
The cessation, settling, and disappearance of the nose …🔽The cessation, settling, and disappearance of the tongue …
The cessation, settling, and disappearance of the body …

original: yo manassa nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ manassa nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti
translated: the cessation, stilling, of the mind is the cessation of suffering, the stilling of diseases, the ending of old age and death.”
the cessation of the mind, its fading away and cessation, is the cessation of suffering, the relinquishing of causes of disease, the fading away of aging and death.”
The first section on the origin is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses on the Origin
With Rādha
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo kho, bhikkhave, rūpānaṁ uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.🔽Yo saddānaṁ …🔽yo gandhānaṁ …
analyzed: yaḥ kho bhikkhave rūpānam uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa isaḥ uppādaḥ rogānaṃ ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ  yaḥ sat dānam  yaḥ gandhānam
translated: “The origination, continuation, arising, and appearance of forms is the origination of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the appearance of aging and death.
The origination, continuation, arising, and appearance of sounds …🔽of smells …🔽of tastes …
of tactile objects …

original: yo dhammānaṁ uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
analyzed: yaḥ dhammānaṃ uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa isaḥ uppādaḥ rogānaṃ ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: of thoughts is the origination of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the appearance of aging and death.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpānaṁ nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo.🔽Yo saddānaṁ …
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave rūpānam nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ  yaḥ sat dānam
translated: The cessation, settling, and ending of forms is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the ending of aging and death.
The cessation, settling, and ending of sounds …
of smells …
of tastes …🔽of tactile objects …

original: yo dhammānaṁ nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 26.3
analyzed: yaḥ dhammānam nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa isaḥ nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti  dutiya  sayutta nikāya
translated: The Connected Discourses on Origination, the second section, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.

original: Sāvatthinidānaṁ.🔽“Yo kho, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññāṇassa uppādo ṭhiti …pe…🔽jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo …pe…🔽yo manoviññāṇassa uppādo ṭhiti …pe…
analyzed: sāvatthi nidāna  yaḥ kho bhikkhave cakkhu viññāṇassa uppādaḥ ṭhiti pe  jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ pe  yaḥ manaḥ viññāṇassa uppādaḥ ṭhiti pe
translated: The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññāṇassa nirodho …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave cakkhu viññāṇassa nirodhaḥ pe
translated: The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.

original: yo manoviññāṇassa nirodho …pe…🔽jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 26.4🔽1. Uppādavagga
analyzed: yaḥ manaḥ viññāṇassa nirodhaḥ pe  jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti  tatiya  sayutta nikāya  uppāda vagga
translated: The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.

original: Sāvatthinidānaṁ.🔽“Yo kho, bhikkhave, cakkhusamphassassa uppādo ṭhiti …pe…🔽jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo …pe…🔽yo manosamphassassa uppādo ṭhiti …pe…
analyzed: sāvatthi nidāna  yaḥ kho bhikkhave cakkhu samphassassa uppādaḥ ṭhiti pe  jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ pe  yaḥ manaḥ samphassassa uppādaḥ pe
translated: The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections, is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Kaccāna, in thirty-two sections

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, cakkhusamphassassa nirodho …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave cakkhu samphassassa nirodhaḥ pe
translated: The cessation of eye contact …
the ending of aging and death …
The cessation of mind contact …
the ending of aging and death.”🔽The fourth section on the ending of existence is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Devadatta, the first section.
The Chapter on Arising
Feeling Arisen from Contact
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo kho, bhikkhave, cakkhusamphassajāya vedanāya uppādo ṭhiti …pe… jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo …pe….
analyzed: yaḥ kho bhikkhave cakkhu samphassa jāya vedanāya uppādaḥ ṭhiti pe jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ pe
translated: “The arising, continuation, development, manifestation, and appearance of feeling arisen from eye contact …

analyzed: yaḥ manaḥ samphassa jāya vedanāya uppādaḥ ṭhiti pe
translated: The arising, continuation, development, manifestation, and appearance of feeling arisen from mind contact …
the manifestation of aging and death.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, cakkhusamphassajāya vedanāya nirodho vūpasamo …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave cakkhu samphassa jāya vedanāya nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ pe
translated: The cessation, settling, and ending of feeling arisen from eye contact …
the ending of aging and death …🔽the ending of aging and death.”

original: yo manosamphassajāya vedanāya nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ manaḥ samphassa jāya vedanāya nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti
translated: The fifth section on the ending of existence is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Devadatta, the first section.
The Chapter on Arising
Perceptions
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo kho, bhikkhave, rūpasaññāya uppādo ṭhiti …pe…🔽jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ kho bhikkhave rūpa saññāyaḥ uppādaḥ ṭhiti pe  jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ pe
translated: “The origination, continuation, and manifestation of form perception …🔽the origination, continuation, and manifestation of sound perception …

original: yo dhammasaññāya uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
analyzed: yaḥ dhamma saññāyaḥ uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa esaḥ uppādaḥ rogānaṃ ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: the origination, continuation, and manifestation of thought perception is the origination of suffering, the continuation of disease, and the manifestation of old age and death.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpasaññāya nirodho …pe…🔽jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave rūpa saññāya nirodhaḥ pe  jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ pe
translated: “The cessation, giving up, and relinquishing of form perception …🔽the cessation, giving up, and relinquishing of sound perception …

original: yo dhammasaññāya nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.🔽Chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ dhamma saññāya nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti  chaṭṭha
translated: the cessation, giving up, and relinquishing of thought perception is the cessation of suffering, the giving up of disease, and the relinquishing of old age and death.”🔽The sixth section on old age and death is finished.
The Connected Discourses with Verses
The Chapter on Intention
Intentional Activities
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Yo kho, bhikkhave, rūpasañcetanāya uppādo ṭhiti …pe…🔽jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ kho bhikkhave rūpa sañcetanāya uppādaḥ ṭhiti pe  jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ pe
translated: “The origination, continuation, and manifestation of intentional activities related to form …🔽the origination, continuation, and manifestation of intentional activities related to sound …

original: yo dhammasañcetanāya uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
analyzed: yaḥ dhamma sañcetanāya uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassesaḥ uppādaḥ rogānaṃ ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: the origination, continuation, and manifestation of intentional activities related to thoughts is the origination of suffering, the continuation of disease, and the manifestation of old age and death.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpasañcetanāya nirodho …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave rūpa sañcetanāya nirodho pe
translated: The cessation of intentness upon form …
the ending of aging-and-death. …

original: yo dhammasañcetanāya nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ dhamma sañcetanāya nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti
translated: The cessation, stilling, of intentness upon mental phenomena is the cessation of stress, the stilling of diseases, the ending of aging-and-death.”
The seventh.
Saṁyutta Nikāya 56.7🔽The Chapter on Arising
Craving
At Sāvatthī.

analyzed: yaḥ kho bhikkhave rūpa taṇhāyaḥ uppādaḥ ṭhiti pe
translated: “The arising, the appearing, of craving for form …
the manifestation of aging-and-death. …

original: yo dhammataṇhāya uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
analyzed: yaḥ dhamma taṇhāyaḥ uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa isaḥ uppādaḥ rogānaṃ ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: The arising, the appearing, of craving for mental phenomena is the arising of stress, the origination of diseases, the manifestation of aging-and-death.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpataṇhāya nirodho …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave rūpa taṇhāya nirodhaḥ pe
translated: The cessation of craving for form …
the ending of aging-and-death. …

original: yo dhammataṇhāya nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ dhamma taṇhāya nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa isaḥ nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti
translated: The cessation, stilling, of craving for mental phenomena is the cessation of stress, the stilling of diseases, the ending of aging-and-death.”
The eighth.
Saṁyutta Nikāya 56.8
The Chapter on Arising
The Elements

original: Sāvatthinidānaṁ.🔽“Yo kho, bhikkhave, pathavīdhātuyā uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo …pe… jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo;
analyzed: sāvatthi nidāna  yaḥ kho bhikkhave pathavī dhātuyāḥ uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ pe jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: At Sāvatthī.

“Bhikkhus, the origination, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of the earth element is the origination of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death. 🔽The origination, continuation, rebirth, and manifestation of the water element … 🔽of the fire element …
of the air element …

original: yo ākāsadhātuyā …🔽yo viññāṇadhātuyā uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
analyzed: yā u ākāsadhātuyā  yaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyāḥ uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa iso uppādaḥ rogānaṃ ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: of the space element … 🔽of the consciousness element is the origination of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, pathavīdhātuyā nirodho …pe… jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo;🔽yo āpodhātuyā nirodho …🔽yo tejodhātuyā nirodho …
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave pathavī dhātuyāḥ nirodhaḥ pe jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamo  nirodhaḥ  nirodhaḥ
translated: “The cessation, settling, and stopping of the earth element is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the stopping of old age and death. 🔽The cessation, settling, and stopping of the water element … 🔽of the fire element …
of the air element …
of the space element …

original: yo viññāṇadhātuyā nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyāḥ nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti
translated: of the consciousness element is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the stopping of old age and death.”
The ninth
Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.100–109
The Chapter with the Threes
The Aggregates
At Sāvatthī. …

original: “Yo kho, bhikkhave, rūpassa uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
analyzed: yaḥ kho bhikkhave rūpassa uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa isaḥ uppādaḥ rogānam ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: “The origin, the creation, the birth, the production, the appearance of form is the origin of suffering, the creation of diseases, the appearance of old age and death.🔽The origin, the creation, the birth, the production, the appearance of feeling …
perception …
volitional formations …

original: yo viññāṇassa uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṁ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
analyzed: yaḥ viññāṇassa uppādaḥ ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvaḥ dukkhassa iso uppādaḥ rogānaṃ ṭhiti jarā maraṇassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: consciousness is the origin of suffering, the creation of diseases, the appearance of old age and death.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpassa nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo.
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave rūpassa nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ
translated: The cessation, the stilling, the disappearance, the giving up, the relinquishing, the release, the non-grasping of form is the cessation of suffering, the stilling of diseases, the disappearance of old age and death.🔽The cessation, the stilling, the disappearance, the giving up, the relinquishing, the release, the non-grasping of feeling …
perception …
volitional formations …

original: yo viññāṇassa nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṁ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ viññāṇassa nirodhaḥ vūpasamaḥ atthaṅgamaḥ dukkhassa iso nirodhaḥ rogānam vūpasamaḥ jarā maraṇassa atthaṅgamaḥ ti
translated: consciousness is the cessation of suffering, the stilling of diseases, the disappearance of old age and death.”
The tenth.🔽The first sub-chapter on origin is finished.
The summary:
Eye, form, and consciousness,

original: phasso ca vedanāya ca;🔽Saññā ca cetanā taṇhā,
analyzed: phasso ca vedanāya ca  saññā ca cetanā taṇhā
translated: Contact, and also feeling,
Perception, and also intention, craving, and element, aggregate—these are the ten.
The Linked Pericope on Arising is finished.
